newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: RTRS-World thermal coal trade to soar 28 pct - ABARE.
newsitem.headline: RTRS-World thermal coal trade to soar 28 pct - ABARE.

text.p: Total world trade in thermal (steaming) coal is projected to increase 28 percent to 369 million tonnes in the year 2002 from 289 million tonnes this year as more coal is used to generate electricity, the Australian Bureau of Agricultural and Resource Economics (ABARE) said in a paper to be delivered later on Tuesday.
In the Asia Pacific region, ABARE said Indonesia will record the highest growth in exports of thermal coal, up a forecast 38 percent over the next five years.
Australian thermal coal exports are projected to increase by 33 percent to 94.7 million tonnes in 2002 from 71 million this year.
Total world metallurgical coal trade has grown little since 1991, but should now increase by almost 14 percent to 221.1 million tonnes by 2002, ABARE said.
The increase is due to a recovery in the production of steel from conventional blast furnaces, ABARE said.
